question: “The Uniting for Peace Resolution” adopted by the U.N. has which of the following features?
option1: Enhanced the powers of the General Assembly in a comprehensive way
option2: Reduced the powers of the General Assembly
option3: Made no difference to the powers of the General Assembly
option4: Empowered the General Assembly to act in specific situations in matters of peace and security
answer: Empowered the General Assembly to act in specific situations in matters of peace and security
explanation: The Uniting for Peace resolution was initiated by the United States and submitted by the \"Joint Seven-Powers\" in October 1950, as a means of circumventing further Soviet vetoes during the course of the Korean War .It was adopted by 52 votes to 5, with 2 abstentions. It has empowered the General Assembly to act in specific situations in matters of peace and security.
